document_title: Foreskin inflammation: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_name: viem-bao-quy-dau.json_1_Distinguish between foreskin inflammation and inflammation of the head of the penis
subsection_content:
Balanitis is often confused with two diseases: phimosis and inflammation of the head of the penis (balanitis). All three conditions affect the penis. However, each disease affects a different part of the penis. (2)
Phimosis is a condition in which the foreskin does not fully retract from the glans.; Inflammation of the head of the penis (balanitis) is an inflammation of the glans.; Balanitis is an inflammation of both the glans and foreskin.
Phimosis can occur along with balanitis or balanitis. Phimosis can easily cause irritation of the glans and foreskin. Once this irritation occurs, symptoms such as pain and swelling can make it more difficult to retract the foreskin.
subsection_title: viem bao quy dau.json. Distinguish between foreskin inflammation and inflammation of the head of the penis

Phimosis can occur along with balanitis or balanitis. Phimosis can easily cause irritation of the glans and foreskin. Once this irritation occurs, symptoms such as pain and swelling can make it more difficult to retract the foreskin.
